bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, July 7, 1890

div1.p: Reed requests a four-month leave of absence to attend to business matters and for pursuing special studies in his profession. Military endorsements and approval of Reed's leave are dated July 7, 1890 to August 18, 1890. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, July 7, 1890
div1.opener:
Mount Vernon Barracks, Ala.
July 7 '1890
To the
Adjutant General
United States Army,
(Through military channel)
General,
div1.p:
I have the honor respectfully to apply for a
leave of absence for the period of four (4) months; the
leave to take effect about the 1st day of September 1890.

I desire this leave for business purposes and,
also, to enable me to avail myself of the opportunity
of pursuing certain special studies in my profession.
div1.closer:
Im. General,
Very Respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant Walter Reed,
Captain, Apt. Surgeon, U.S.A.
